title: Dear Riot - In Game Voice Communication
body:
Hi I'd like to know why there hasn't been voice software implemented into League of Legends when we are so heavily reliant on working together as a team. 

I think people would be less toxic to each other if they could communicate properly. People couldn't hide behind a text wall and would be forced to say ugly things out loud. 

Also why can't I mute individuals pings? I can mute their text chat but we all know how passive aggressive people can be with the ping system.

If you could answer these few questions I'd be ever so grateful.

replies.body:
Just my opinion here, but I would rather we didn't have voice chat. Not because it wouldn't help in games, but rather because I think it would make our toxicity problem a lot worse.

I can shrug off being harassed through chat fairly easily. There's no real human connection there,_ it doesn't feel real_. But being harassed through voice chat is very different IMO, you can sense the persons intent. It can actually get a little traumatizing.

I know about opt-in and all that, but TBH the mute button is essentially the same thing and so many people still struggle to use it.

Just something to consider.

> _**Anyway, here's the status on voice chat ATM:**_
> + [This](http://www.twitlonger.com/show/n_1soo9ou) is what **Riot Pwyff** said on the issue recently:
> 
>  "_Our stance on voice comms has changed. Absolutely makes sense for premade parties, we'd like to sort through the voice chat with strangers (opt-in scenarios?) but it's not something we're against. I hate to be the guy who says maybe one day, but our #1 priority is LCU and that's a massive undertaking._"
> 
> In other words, we can expect it after the new client is complete. Hopefully **Riot** will update us on voice comms then.

I hope this helps :D

It would either make things better or worse but there is no finding out unless there is some way to test it. If League is such a toxic community, then why isn't it their first priority? I think part of it is not being able to communicate properly when there is someone walking up the river and you can tell top lane instead of sacrificing a few CS to type it. Even then they might not even see if they're tunnel visioning CS themselves or a trade top. 

Is Riot looking at what is the cause of making people toxic and finding ways to improve the community on their end? From experience people generally only become toxic when they've had a few games in a row where someone has either AFK'd, fed or they've just had a loss. Getting into a fresh game where someone again goes 0-9-0 usually triggers that "omg what the hell are you doing". Then from that the person who is feeding already feels bad and tilts himself. This type of tilting is avoidable if people have a clear head and take breaks and they'll play better ovall and maybe be able to carry. 

So instead of looking at the LCU for months on end so it's easier for us to buy things from the shop they should be looking at data as to why people become toxic in the first place and find solutions for that.

League's community is the **only** priority for the Player Behavior Team. They work on countless projects all the time with the aim of reducing toxicity and improving the player experience.

_**Even just recently: **_

+ _Players were tired of arguing about who got which role in ranked._ 

 The player behavior team stepped in and introduced the new champion select (not to be confused with Dynamic Queue).

+ _AFK's ruining games have been a long time issue in League._

 The player behavior team developed [/remake](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/play-games-matter/remake) and is going to launch it in patch 6.12

Not to mention all the countless programs before this; honor system, Instant Feedback, the Tribunal, LeaverBuster... etc. 

The player behavior team does a lot for us, but most of their work is overshadowed by champion releases and other more exciting content.

__*

> _"Instead of looking at the LCU for months on end so it's easier for us to buy things from the shop they should be looking at data as to why people become toxic in the first place and find solutions for that."_

LCU is being prioritised ATM because it's [holding back other projects](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update/article/d1cc6571-3981-479b-abcf-9b073cfd918a). Once it's complete, it will open up opportunities for the player behavior team to add new systems and content to the client.

The player behavior team already knows a good deal about why people are toxic. **Lyte** did some revolutionary research for the gaming industry in this field for **Riot**. You can find some talks he did [here](http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player) and [here](http://www.gdcvault.com/play/1022160/More-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player) if you're interested.

You only have to look at the history of Riot to see that player toxicity isn't a main priority. You said it yourself that most things are overshadowed by champion releases and more exciting content, which is probably skins, so that indicates where their focus is. I'm not bashing Riot or trying to start something here but I do want the overall game play experience to improve.

 Their focus is on making money and it always will be. If toxicity was important they would of released an update with being able to separately mute peoples pings instead of spending countless hours designing Hextech Crafting. I'm not saying that will single handily destroy toxicity but it will be a great stepping stone towards improving game play. 

I don't believe for a second that there is a large focus on toxicity and there might be a team but I can believe it's probably 4 guys who work part time as opposed to the 50 in skin design. You don't have all the answers I'm sure but if you have someones ear you have the chance to improve the game. 

I think most people who play League, specifically ranked, don't enjoy the game that much in comparison to other games. But we play it because of the grind and the small reward of climbing that division. I think we would enjoy it a lot more overall if we weren't experiencing that 2/5 games where everyone on your team is arguing in the game chat because they're all tilted. 

Anyway, thanks for replying, have a nice day.

_**There's a big difference between saying Riot's efforts aren't working, as opposed to Riot isn't doing anything.**_ I think you might be getting them confused.

> "Their focus is on making money and it always will be."


+ Absolutely true. At the end of the day, they are a just private company like any other.

 That said, don't forget that toxicity is one of the largest reasons why people uninstall League. If more people play League, more skins are sold. Therefore it's in **Riot**'s best interests to get rid of toxicity and keep Summoners playing for longer.

> I can believe it's probably 4 guys who work part time as opposed to the 50 in skin design.

+ The Player Behavior team has [34 full time members](http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player), of which 3 have a Ph.D. These people are going in to work 40+ hours a week to try and reduce the impact toxicity has in League.

 I don't know if the skins team is larger. They probably are, but I strongly doubt they have anyone with a Ph.D on that team.

__*

To be fair the player behavior team has been a little slow recently, but it doesn't mean they stopped caring.

Just wanted to clear that up :P

Haha well it's interesting to note that they have a Ph.D and I hope that helps them. Thanks for getting back to me and replying you've been very helpful. 

(:

I notice you conveniently didn't address the inability to mute players pings? Often someone abuses me, I mute them and then they will spam caution ping on me over and over.

Usually if I leave something out it's because it wasn't relevant or I don't know much about it, in this case it was the latter.

_**But since you asked, here's what I know:**_

+ In patch [v1.0.0.86](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/V1.0.0.86), the mute button would silence both chat and pings. Later on in Season 3, this was changed to only chat.

 At the time it was a common complaint to not be able to [mute pings separately](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2813562). I assume at the time **Riot** didn't have the resources to spare for a new mute button. Instead they just limited mute to only chat.

That was before, as for now I don't know why two buttons have not been added. 

If you're looking for answers the best person to ask is [**Riot Ghostcrawler**](http://ask.fm/RiotGhostcrawler). I've found he's more likely to reply if you ask around at 2 -3 pm (PST).
You can use a program called "curse" it works great and was designed to work specifically with the league of legends client.
It's been a long fought process still to no avail Bunny. This has been on the cards since season one.  Even riot na wouldn't provide a reasonable answer.

I'm fairly certain i recall Riot having made a statement on this.

Actually looked it up, and it appears that Riot Lyte took down his Ask FM, which from what i can tell is the response i am remembering, i will do some more digging, but i have a feeling this might have been the one i was thinking of.

EDIT: Here is an overview of the response from Lyte
http://newsoflegends.com/index.php/lyte-on-why-there-is-no-voice-chat-in-league-but-might-be-when-you-are-chat-restricted-for-not-talking-ironstylus-talks-caitlyns-design-and-more-20942/

>People couldn't hide behind a text wall and would be forced to say ugly things out loud.

No one who is typing that shit would be hindered by having to say it, hell it would just make it easier to be toxic.

At least with third party voice comms, it's always opt in rather than opt out (which is the better scenario.)

I feel like the toxicity would be worse because instead of typing something toxic why not just say it in the voice chat. However, if they ever add a voice chat feature in league of legends then they should make a mute/block/report button for toxic players in the voice chat. It's also good if they have an option to enter or exit the voice chat as some people actually do really well without voice chat and stuff. This would also be an issue for girls as you know how boys are, a girls starts talking and the whole team goes crazy. I believe that riot would implement this idea soon to the game though. Just be patient :)
So pedo's can't talk to all the little children in the game.
